title: Letter: House Democrats are the ones abusing power
text:
Democrats are accusing the president of abuse of power, but I assert they are the ones abusing power.

The impeachment proceedings began with an inquiry that went straight to committee without discussion on the floor of the House or a roll-call vote on the floor.

The Republicans were prevented from subpoenaing the whistleblower, who is not entitled to anonymity despite what the Democrats say. The "face your accuser" clause of the U.S. Constitution would prevent this. And now House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is refusing to send the impeachment articles to the Senate.

Former U.S. representative and prosecutor Trey Gowdy said a prosecutor generally won’t file charges (articles of impeachment in this case) unless they are sure the evidence if substantial enough to ensure a conviction. By refusing to send the articles to the Senate, Pelosi is not only violating the impeachment guidelines of the Constitution but also trying to usurp the constitutional authority of the Senate.

So I everyone should ask themselves: Who is abusing power?

Jason Davis, Lancaster
